snippet: Victim advocacy groups have long criticized the definition of “forcible rape,” in use since the 1920s, as outdated.
abstract: Federal government is changing its longstanding definition of 'forcible rape' in compiling national crime statistics, expanding both the definition of victims, to include males, and the types of sexual assault that will be counted in the Federal Bureau of Investigation's Uniform Crime Report.
lead_paragraph: Victim advocacy groups have long criticized the definition of “forcible rape,” in use since the 1920s, as outdated.

headline.seo: Federal Crime Statistics to Expand Rape Definition
headline.main: U.S. to Expand Its Definition of Rape in Statistics
headline.print_headline: U.S. to Expand Its Definition Of Rape In Statistics
